situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The poodle has 3 friends that are loyal and two friends that are not, has a card that is indigo in color, and is watching a movie from 1991. The poodle is named Lily. The woodpecker is named Teddy. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: Here is an important piece of information about the poodle: if it is watching a movie that was released before Obama's presidency started then it swears to the bulldog for sure. Rule2: If the poodle has a card with a primary color, then the poodle shouts at the gadwall. Rule3: Here is an important piece of information about the poodle: if it has more than one friend then it shouts at the gadwall for sure. Rule4: The poodle will not shout at the gadwall if it (the poodle) is less than 6 years old. Rule5: Here is an important piece of information about the poodle: if it has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the woodpecker's name then it does not shout at the gadwall for sure. Rule6: If you are positive that you saw one of the animals shouts at the gadwall, you can be certain that it will not create a castle for the bison. Rule7: Are you certain that one of the animals brings an oil tank for the walrus and also at the same time swears to the bulldog? Then you can also be certain that the same animal creates one castle for the bison. Rule4 is preferred over Rule2. Rule4 is preferred over Rule3. Rule5 is preferred over Rule2. Rule5 is preferred over Rule3. Rule7 is preferred over Rule6.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the poodle create one castle for the bison?
label: disproved
